database--data-engineering.title: Relational Database Management System
database--data-engineering.summary: This article provides an overview of Relational Database Management Systems (RDBMS), covering key features such as data representation through tables, transaction principles (Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability), and concepts like primary and foreign keys. It highlights the importance of data integrity, security, normalization, and referential integrity in maintaining valid relationships between tables for effective data management.

database--data-engineering.title: ER Modeling and Normalization
database--data-engineering.summary: This article covers Entity-Relationship (E-R) Modeling, which visually depicts the relationships between identifiable entities in a database. It discusses key concepts such as entities and their attributes, relationships and cardinality, and the importance of normalization (1NF, 2NF, 3NF) to optimize data structure and reduce redundancy for improved data integrity and efficiency.

database--data-engineering.title: Dimensional Modeling - Part 1: Basic Fact Table Techniques
database--data-engineering.summary: In this article, I will introduce the concept of the Basic Fact table in Dimensional data modeling. To understand this technique, we will explore the different types of data modeling and recap some fundamental knowledge, including the star and snowflake schemas, and the concepts of normalization.

database--data-engineering.title: Dimensional Modeling - Part 2: Basic Dimension Table Techniques
database--data-engineering.summary: The topics covered include Degenerate Dimension, Conformed Dimension, Role-Playing Dimension, Junk Dimension, Outrigger Dimension, and Slowly Changing Dimensions (SCD). The SCD category further delves into different types, such as Type 0 to Type 7, each with its unique approach to handling historical and changing data.

llms.title: LLMs in LangChain - Part 1. Conceptual
llms.summary: This article provides an overview of Large Language Models (LLMs), LLMs evolution and the core concepts of LangChain - an open source framework for building applications based on LLMs.

llms.title: LLMs in LangChain - Part 2. LLMs Core Concepts
llms.summary: This article provides an overview of the core concepts of Large Language Models (LLMs) in LangChain, including LLM components, prompt templates, indexing, memory, chains, and agents.
